WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 The White House endorsed the Model Cities program today as a means of helping to achieve President Nixon's "new federalism," which would give more money and authority to the state and local governments.

EL KHANA, Jordan, Sept. 10 Passengers and crew members of a British airliner that was hijacked and flown here yesterday told visitors today that their Arab commando captors had provided them with no food in the almost 24 hours since the plane landed.

The New York Stock Exchange reaffirmed yesterday its support of the investor-protection legislation that is now pending in Congress. In an unusual action taken in response ... to what the exchange called "misleading reports," the board of governors formally passed a resolution endorsing the bills that would provide for a securities investor protection corporation to be used in case of brokerage-house failures.

LOS ANGELES, Sept. 10 A bearded man, wearing a sweatshirt and blue jeans, told a jury today that he had once seen Charles M. Manson carrying a 22-caliber pistol similar to the one that the police have said was used in the murders of Sharon Tate, the actress, and four other persons.
The New York and the American Stock Exchanges yesterday announced a change in the publication date of the monthly reports on short interest.
Representative Richard L. Ottinger charged yesterday that proposed Federal restrictions on low-cost charter flights would "virtually strangle" nonscheduled airlines.

Shareholders of Benguet Consolidated, Inc., flew into a tizzy yesterday on the heels or an announcement by the Bahamas Government that a Royal Commission would look into the future of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island.
The Metropolitan Transportation Authority yesterday retained two engineering concerns to draw final design plans for extending the Long Island Railroad to Kennedy International Airport.
FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Sept. 10 (Reuters) A Chinese millionaire, C.Y. Tung, flew out of here today after buying the former traps-Atlantic liner Queen Elizabeth for $3.2-million.

Eight American designers perused each other's work the other night at Bonwit Teller and found it good. Oscar de la Renta thought everybody's clothes looked "absolutely marvelous," Pauline Trigere said, "It keeps you on your toes to see such fabulous competition," Bill Blass ...

STAMFORD, Conn., Sept 10 (AP) Teachers here agreed today to return to work tomorrow in the first major breakthrough in teachers' strikes that had been disrupting normal classroom operations in eight Connecticut communities.

Well, they're in for it. It was inevitable once men strayed from the sanctified sack suit and button-down shirt look. They're now up against the same ceremonies women have long undergone. Fashion shows. Fashion show commentators. Hemlines rising and falling. Even fashioninfluential films.
The city's blood-shortage emergency, which lasted for eight days, was officially declared to be over yesterday with the city's blood reserves finally back at an "acceptable" level.
The job of Police Commissioner has been offered by Mayor, Lindsay to Detroit's Police Commissioner, Patrick V. Murphy.
CAIRO, Sept. 10 A high official source here, reflecting Government opinion, criticized today the hijacking of airliners.
WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 Senators of both parties informally agreed today on an imposing work schedule for the next five weeks that could permit them to adjourn for the political campaign by mid-October.

The semifinal trial matches that will help to determine part of the North American representation in the 1971 world championship in Formosa begin here tonight at the New York Hilton. The matches will be of 144 deals and will end Sunday.

GARDEN CITY, L.I., Sept. 10 Dr. and Mrs. Francis Anthony Beneventi have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lucinda Lockwood Beneventi, to William Robert Findley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Floyd R. Findley of Toledo, Ohio.

SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 10 (UPI) United States headquarters reported today that 65 Americans were killed fighting in Vietnam last week and added to the list 22 names of those killed in a helicopter crash Aug. 27. The total, 87, was the highest reported in 10 weeks.

The contradictions of the American ideal were ironically brought out last night in an evening of many television specials. One was "The Ice People," a study by Craig Fisher of how the white man's culture had undermined the nobility of the Eskimo and had reduced him to welfare peonage. The other was "A Salute to the U.S.A.," a melodic ode to a country having no problems that love couldn't conquer.

Award. President Nixon awarded the Presidential Unit Citation for extraordinary heroism to the Eighth Tactical Bombardment Squadron of the Air Force. The award was made in connection with operations against the enemy in Southeast Asia from Nov. 15, 1968, to May 31, 1969.
The Rev. Dr. Arthur Lessner Swift Jr., a leader in church community work here for many years, died yesterday in Redlands, Calif., where he lived. He was 78 years old.

ROYAL OAK, Mich., Sept. 10 The Oldsmobile Division of General Motors displayed its 1971 models at a news preview today. They include a drastically restyled frontwheel drive Toronado and a modest revamping of the rest of the 28-model line.
A New York man sent a message to his boss from the Intercontinental Hotel in Amman, Jordan. It read: "Sorry. Unable to be at work Monday morning. Delayed by hijacking."
Management and clerical employes in about 1,000 apartment buildings that are slated for demolition went on strike yesterday morning in all boroughs of the city except Richmond.
The Federal Reserve System's credit policy eased further in the last two weeks, banking data published yesterday showed.
BALTIMORE, Sept. 10 Beaten by the Yankees a little more than a week ago in his effort to achieve a 10-game winning streak, Dave McNally got some measure of revenge tonight.
New price tags were announced yesterday for a variety of widely used chemicals. Most of the changes were upward.

David Melendez knocked out Ricky Ortiz last night in 1:22 of the sixth round of their scheduled 10-round welterweight bout at Sunnyside Garden, Sunnyside, Queens. Melendez dropped his rival with a left hook to the chin.
